meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Jeopardy Archive Daphne Moulton Richard Block Joel Pool Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #6387.

td.p: Daphne Moulton, a finance administrator from Lakeville, Massachusetts
Richard Block, an editor and writer from Diamond Bar, California
Joel Pool, a real estate developer from Oakland, California (whose 6-day cash winnings total $116,800)

tr.td: ANNUAL EVENTS
PSYCHOLOGY
READINGS FROM 1984
ORG. ABBREV.
COMIC BOOKS
"OW"! "OOF"! "ACK"!

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_1_1', 'clue_J_1_1_stuck', 'A 1971 law moved this observance to the fourth Monday in October; in 1978 it moved back to its November date')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: A 1971 law moved this observance to the fourth Monday in October; in 1978 it moved back to its November date

(Alex: Well, it paid off.)

the Avengers

Joel
')

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_J_6_5', 'clue_J_6_5_stuck', '(Joel: [Long pause, then just as time is out] What is [*]?)
(Alex: [Looking at the judges] Did he get it in in time? No, sorry. Time ran out.)
[Richard rings in immediately.]

a shackle

JoelRichard
')

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_DJ_2_1', 'clue_DJ_2_1_stuck', '(Kelly of the Clue Crew stirs packing peanuts into a clear liquid.) Packing peanuts made from corn & potato starch could one day replace Styrofoam & reduce landfill waste, because unlike Styrofoam, these peanuts are this, meaning they are readily decomposable')

tr.td: (Kelly of the Clue Crew stirs packing peanuts into a clear liquid.) Packing peanuts made from corn & potato starch could one day replace Styrofoam & reduce landfill waste, because unlike Styrofoam, these peanuts are this, meaning they are readily decomposable

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', '(Alex: Those three names should take you to the proper locale.)
...
(Alex: [After Joel\'s reveal] Right author, wrong work.)
...
(Alex: [After Daphne\'s reveal] Is that the only one you guys know?)
...
(Alex: [After Richard\'s reveal] No. Luxor, Assuan, and Khartoum are cities in Africa, on the Nile. We are talking about Agatha Christie\'s [*], Hercule Poirot story.)
JoelWhat is Murder on the Orient Express
$3,200
DaphneWhat is Murder on the Orient Express?
$4,000
RichardWhat is Murder on the Orient Express?
$1,799
Death on the Nile')
div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', 'A letter in this mystery says, "We are going... to Luxor and Assuan by steamer, and perhaps on to Khartoum"')

tr.td: CLASSIC MYSTERY NOVELS
A letter in this mystery says, "We are going... to Luxor and Assuan by steamer, and perhaps on to Khartoum"
Joel
Richard
Daphne
3rd place: $1,000
New champion: $12,001
2nd place: $2,000
Joel
Richard
Daphne

13 R
(including 1 DD),
5 W

10 R,
3 W
(including 1 DD)
